ConditionTitle: LAutomatic or manual emergency warning systems

&ESCAPE&ROUTE PRESSURISATION SYSTEMS

(Performance Standards: AS 1668.1:1998, AS 1851.6:2012)

 

 

A. Inspections

Escape route including corridor or lift shaft pressurisation systems shall be inspected regularly to ensure continued effective operation. Inspection content shall be in accordance with AS 1851 and or AS 1668.1 or the designer's recommendations as is appropriate for the installation.

is not obstructed by curtains or drapes.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventative and responsive maintenance required to ensure that the system will operate as required in the event of fire. Such shall be maintained in accordance with above standards or the designer's recommended maintenance procedures, as is appropriate.

 

Defects shall be remedied immediately that they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Records must be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken

v. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vi. Name of person undertaking inspection
ConditionHelpText:
$Specified$ System: 123

 

ESCAPE ROUTE PRESSURISATION SYSTEMS

(Performance Standards: AS 1668.1:1998, AS 1851.6:2012)

 

 

A. Inspections

Escape route including corridor or lift shaft pressurisation systems shall be inspected regularly to ensure continued effective operation. Inspection content shall be in accordance with AS 1851 and or AS 1668.1 or the designer's recommendations as is appropriate for the installation.

is not obstructed by curtains or drapes.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventative and responsive maintenance required to ensure that the system will operate as required in the event of fire. Such shall be maintained in accordance with above standards or the designer's recommended maintenance procedures, as is appropriate.

 

Defects shall be remedied immediately that they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Records must be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken

v. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vi. Name of person undertaking inspection

MANUAL OR AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY WARNING SYSTEMS FOR FIRE OR OTHER DANGERS

AUTOMATIC GAS LEAK DETECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE DETECTION AND

MEASUREMENT OF COMBUSTIBLE GASES

(Performance Standards: NZS 5263:2003)

 

Type:

Make:

 

A. Inspections

Gas detectionsystems shall be inspected for compliance with NZS 5263 or otherrecognised national standards. In no case shall the period between calibrations of the gas detection apparatus exceed 6 months.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection

Specified System: 2.2

MANUAL OR AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY WARNING SYSTEMS FOR FIRE OR OTHER DANGERS

AUTOMATIC GAS LEAK DETECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE DETECTION AND

MEASUREMENT OF COMBUSTIBLE GASES

(Performance Standards: NZS 5263:2003)

 

Type:

Make:

 

A. Inspections

Gas detectionsystems shall be inspected for compliance with NZS 5263 or otherrecognised national standards. In no case shall the period between calibrations of the gas detection apparatus exceed 6 months.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventativeand responsive maintenance required to ensure that the systemwill operate as required in the event of an emergency. specifications or in the absence of these in accordance with an appropriate standard such as NZS 5263.

 

Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection
ConditionHelpText:
Specified System: 2.2

MANUAL OR AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY WARNING SYSTEMS FOR FIRE OR OTHER DANGERS

AUTOMATIC GAS LEAK DETECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE DETECTION AND

MEASUREMENT OF COMBUSTIBLE GASES

(Performance Standards: NZS 5263:2003)

 

Type:

Make:

 

A. Inspections

Gas detectionsystems shall be inspected for compliance with NZS 5263 or otherrecognised national standards. In no case shall the period between calibrations of the gas detection apparatus exceed 6 months.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventativeand responsive maintenance required to ensure that the systemwill operate as required in the event of an emergency. Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection

Specified System: 2.2

MANUAL OR AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY WARNING SYSTEMS FOR FIRE OR OTHER DANGERS

AUTOMATIC GAS LEAK DETECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE DETECTION AND

MEASUREMENT OF COMBUSTIBLE GASES

(Performance Standards: NZS 5263:2003)

 

Type:

Make:

 

A. Inspections

Gas detectionsystems shall be inspected for compliance with NZS 5263 or otherrecognised national standards. In no case shall the period between calibrations of the gas detection apparatus exceed 6 months.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventativeand responsive maintenance required to ensure that the systemwill operate as required in the event of an emergency. specifications or in the absence of these in accordance with an appropriate standard such as NZS 5263.

 

Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection
ConditionText:
&nik& System: 123

 

&ESCAPE&ROUTE PRESSURISATION SYSTEMS

(Performance Standards: AS 1668.1:1998, AS 1851.6:2012)

 

 

A. Inspections

Escape route including corridor or lift shaft pressurisation systems shall be inspected regularly to ensure continued effective operation. Inspection content shall be in accordance with AS 1851 and or AS 1668.1 or the designer's recommendations as is appropriate for the installation.

is not obstructed by curtains or drapes.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventative and responsive maintenance required to ensure that the system will operate as required in the event of fire. Such shall be maintained in accordance with above standards or the designer's recommended maintenance procedures, as is appropriate.

 

Defects shall be remedied immediately that they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Records must be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken

v. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vi. Name of person undertaking inspection
ConditionHelpText:
$Specified$ System: 123

 

ESCAPE ROUTE PRESSURISATION SYSTEMS

(Performance Standards: AS 1668.1:1998, AS 1851.6:2012)

 

 

A. Inspections

Escape route including corridor or lift shaft pressurisation systems shall be inspected regularly to ensure continued effective operation. Inspection content shall be in accordance with AS 1851 and or AS 1668.1 or the designer's recommendations as is appropriate for the installation.

is not obstructed by curtains or drapes.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventative and responsive maintenance required to ensure that the system will operate as required in the event of fire. Such shall be maintained in accordance with above standards or the designer's recommended maintenance procedures, as is appropriate.

 

Defects shall be remedied immediately that they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Records must be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken

v. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vi. Name of person undertaking inspection

MANUAL OR AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY WARNING SYSTEMS FOR FIRE OR OTHER DANGERS

AUTOMATIC GAS LEAK DETECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE DETECTION AND

MEASUREMENT OF COMBUSTIBLE GASES

(Performance Standards: NZS 5263:2003)

 

Type:

Make:

 

A. Inspections

Gas detectionsystems shall be inspected for compliance with NZS 5263 or otherrecognised national standards. In no case shall the period between calibrations of the gas detection apparatus exceed 6 months.

 

 

B. Maintenance

specifications or in the absence of these in accordance with an appropriate standard such as NZS 5263.

 

Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection

Specified System: 2.2

MANUAL OR AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY WARNING SYSTEMS FOR FIRE OR OTHER DANGERS

AUTOMATIC GAS LEAK DETECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE DETECTION AND

MEASUREMENT OF COMBUSTIBLE GASES

(Performance Standards: NZS 5263:2003)

 

Type:

Make:

 

A. Inspections

Gas detectionsystems shall be inspected for compliance with NZS 5263 or otherrecognised national standards. In no case shall the period between calibrations of the gas detection apparatus exceed 6 months.

 

 

B. Maintenance

specifications or in the absence of these in accordance with an appropriate standard such as NZS 5263.

 

Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection
ConditionHelpText:
Specified System: 2.2

MANUAL OR AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY WARNING SYSTEMS FOR FIRE OR OTHER DANGERS

AUTOMATIC GAS LEAK DETECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE DETECTION AND

MEASUREMENT OF COMBUSTIBLE GASES

(Performance Standards: NZS 5263:2003)

 

Type:

Make:

 

A. Inspections

Gas detectionsystems shall be inspected for compliance with NZS 5263 or otherrecognised national standards. In no case shall the period between calibrations of the gas detection apparatus exceed 6 months.

 

 

B. Maintenance

specifications or in the absence of these in accordance with an appropriate standard such as NZS 5263.

 

Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection

Specified System: 2.2

MANUAL OR AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY WARNING SYSTEMS FOR FIRE OR OTHER DANGERS

AUTOMATIC GAS LEAK DETECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE DETECTION AND

MEASUREMENT OF COMBUSTIBLE GASES

(Performance Standards: NZS 5263:2003)

 

Type:

Make:

 

A. Inspections

Gas detectionsystems shall be inspected for compliance with NZS 5263 or otherrecognised national standards. In no case shall the period between calibrations of the gas detection apparatus exceed 6 months.

 

 

B. Maintenance

specifications or in the absence of these in accordance with an appropriate standard such as NZS 5263.

 

Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection
ConditionText:
&nik& System: 123

 

&ESCAPE&ROUTE PRESSURISATION SYSTEMS

(Performance Standards: AS 1668.1:1998, AS 1851.6:2012)

 

 

A. Inspections

Escape route including corridor or lift shaft pressurisation systems shall be inspected regularly to ensure continued effective operation. Inspection content shall be in accordance with AS 1851 and or AS 1668.1 or the designer's recommendations as is appropriate for the installation.

Defects shall be immediately remedied when they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Recordsmust be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection

is not obstructed by curtains or drapes.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventative and responsive maintenance required to ensure that the system will operate as required in the event of fire. Such shall be maintained in accordance with above standards or the designer's recommended maintenance procedures, as is appropriate.

 

Defects shall be remedied immediately that they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Records must be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken

v. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vi. Name of person undertaking inspection
ConditionHelpText:
$Specified$ System: 123

 

ESCAPE ROUTE PRESSURISATION SYSTEMS

(Performance Standards: AS 1668.1:1998, AS 1851.6:2012)

 

 

A. Inspections

Escape route including corridor or lift shaft pressurisation systems shall be inspected regularly to ensure continued effective operation. Inspection content shall be in accordance with AS 1851 and or AS 1668.1 or the designer's recommendations as is appropriate for the installation.

is not obstructed by curtains or drapes.

 

 

B. Maintenance

Planned preventative and responsive maintenance required to ensure that the system will operate as required in the event of fire. Such shall be maintained in accordance with above standards or the designer's recommended maintenance procedures, as is appropriate.

 

Defects shall be remedied immediately that they become apparent.

 

 

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

Records must be retained for a period of two years, on the premises, or any other location agreed to with Auckland Council and includes:

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken

v. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vi. Name of person undertaking inspection

C. Persons responsible

An independent qualified person shall undertake the above inspection and maintenance procedures.

 

 

D. Records

i. Date of inspection

ii. Type of inspection

iii. Any repairs or maintenance found to be required

iv. Action taken to repair or maintain the system

v. The standard used for inspection and maintenance

vi. The system inspected complies with the requirements of the compliance schedule

vii. Name of person undertaking inspection
